name: LEVOCETIRIZINE DIHYDROCHLORIDE
indications: levocetirizine dihydrochloride tablets histamine h 1 -receptor antagonist indicated : • relief symptoms associated perennial allergic rhinitis ( 1.1 ) • treatment uncomplicated skin manifestations chronic idiopathic urticaria ( 1.2 )
contraindications: levocetirizine dihydrochloride tablets available 5 mg breakable ( scored ) tablets , allowing 2.5 mg , needed . levocetirizine dihydrochloride tablets taken without regard food consumption .
warningsAndPrecautions: levocetirizine dihydrochloride tablets , usp white , oval , film coated biconvex tablets , one side embossed ' g ' breakline ' g ' side plain contains 5 mg levocetirizine dihydrochloride . supplied hdpe bottles . 30 tablets ( ndc 82804-204-30 ) storage store 20°c 25°c ( 68°f 77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15°c 30°c ( 59°f 86°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] .
indications_original: Levocetirizine dihydrochloride tablets are a histamine H 1 -receptor antagonist indicated for: • The relief of symptoms associated with perennial allergic rhinitis ( 1.1 ) • The treatment of the uncomplicated skin manifestations of chronic idiopathic urticaria ( 1.2 )
contraindications_original: Levocetirizine dihydrochloride tablets are available as 5 mg breakable (scored) tablets, allowing for the administration of 2.5 mg, if needed. Levocetirizine dihydrochloride tablets can be taken without regard to food consumption.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Levocetirizine Dihydrochloride Tablets, USP are white, oval, film coated biconvex tablets, one side embossed with 'G' breakline 'G' and the other side plain and contains 5 mg levocetirizine dihydrochloride. They are supplied in HDPE bottles.
                  30 Tablets (NDC 82804-204-30)
                  
                     Storage
                  
                  Store at 20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F); excursions permitted to 15°C to 30°C (59°F to 86°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
adverseReactions_original: The use of levocetirizine dihydrochloride tablets are contraindicated in:
